meanings.definition: A person who works during a strike to keep a business operating.
meanings.sent1: The strikebreaker helped the company stay open during the strike.
meanings.sent2: The strikebreaker was hired to work while others were on strike.
meanings.sent3: The strikebreaker brought donuts to the picket line, trying to make friends.
meanings.sent4: She was a strikebreaker, a lone figure in the storm of labor disputes.
meanings.sent5: The strikebreaker's presence was like a bright light in the darkness of the strike.

meanings.sent1: He decided to strikebreak and crossed the picket line to work.
meanings.sent2: She strikebreaks whenever there is a labor disagreement.
meanings.sent3: The workers were surprised when he strikebroke and took their place.
meanings.sent4: In the eyes of the strikers, he strikebroke their unity.
meanings.sent5: To strikebreak is to step into the middle of a conflict and take a side.
